results.firPara: Despite questions about how Gonzalo Higuaín will fit in, Juventus have added more depth and variation and are favourites to seal a sixth-straight championshi
results.secPara: In the five years since Germany overtook Italy in Uefas rankings, stealing a Champions League berth away from clubs on the peninsula, pundits have pontificated at length on the lessons that Serie A might learn from the Bundesliga. Many have called for a greater focus on youth and homegrown talent, as well as the construction of stadiums.
results.webTitle: Juventus to dominate Serie A title race but there will be plenty of drama | Paolo Bandini

results.firPara: Mauricio Pochettino has expressed his confidence that Christian Eriksen will sign a new contract at Tottenham Hotspur, saying that agreement is just a question of time.
results.secPara: The Denmark midfielder, who is so fundamental to Pochettinos team, particularly because of his set-piece deliveries, has been in negotiations over fresh terms for some weeks, with only two years to run on his existing deal.
results.webTitle: Mauricio Pochettino confident over new Tottenham deal for Christian Eriksen

results.firPara: • Klopp rejects criticism of Spaniards performance in Arsenal match
results.secPara: • Klopp rejects criticism of Spaniards performance in Arsenal match
results.webTitle: Jürgen Klopp defends under-fire Liverpool left-back Alberto Moreno

results.firPara: • Manager admits he is in market for new central defender
results.secPara: Arsène Wenger has reassured Arsenal supporters he is working hard to bring in new players before the end of the transfer window but admitted he will only enter the market if he is convinced they can add to his squad.
results.webTitle: Arsenal’s Arsène Wenger ‘working hard’ on transfers but won’t be held to ransom

results.firPara: These are, it must be stressed, very early days. Things will change, things will develop and besides, one of Pep Guardiolas greatest skills is his protean nature, his capacity and willingness to change approach game by game – something that will be tested by the flood of matches an English season brings. But two games in to his competitive tenure as manager of Manchester City, certain patterns have already begun to emerge.
results.secPara: The most obvious, perhaps, is the dropping of Joe Hart for Willy Caballero with a deal for Claudio Bravo seemingly imminent. Perhaps Harts two weak-wristed errors at Euro 2016 played a part in his thinking but the bigger issue appears to be his footwork.
results.webTitle: The Question: can De Bruyne and Silva prosper in their ‘free No8’ roles?

results.firPara: In 1924, Farrell, a star of the early days of American soccer, travelled to Paris for the Olympics – and helped his side record USAs first-ever win on foreign soil
results.secPara: In 1924, Farrell, a star of the early days of American soccer, travelled to Paris for the Olympics – and helped his side record USAs first-ever win on foreign soil
results.webTitle: Henry Farrell, the man who helped the US soccer team make Olympic history
Football transfer rumours: Joe Hart to Everton or Sevilla?

results.firPara: It was not the smoothest of take-offs but, at the third attempt, Newcastle Uniteds Rafa-lution finally became airborne. With the final score slightly flattering, there were quite a few nervous moments and, at times, Reading made life uncomfortable for Rafael Benítezs still gelling team.
results.secPara: Eventually, though, a morale-boosting first win of the season rekindled hope on the Tyne. It was most important to get three points today, the Newcastle manager said after a match featuring two goals from Dwight Gayle. We can play better and be stronger and Im sure well improve, but we showed character.
results.webTitle: Dwight Gayle’s double gives Newcastle United lift-off against Reading

results.firPara: For 54 minutes this appeared a defining occasion for Brendan Rodgers and Celtic. What happened next ensured that, however the former Liverpool managers tenure in Glasgow is to play out, there will be few more frantic or, surely, more entertaining games.
results.secPara: Celtic were enjoying a procession towards the Champions League group stage when 3-0 ahead. Hapoel Beer-Sheva roared back with a quickfire double, triggering Celtic panic. I couldnt say I was totally calm at that point, Rodgers said with a smile when the dust settled.
results.webTitle: Celtic edge nearer group stage despite fright against Hapoel Beer-Sheva

results.firPara: In an exclusive interview, the Valencia winger talks about being dropped by David Moyes at Manchester United, growing up in a crime-ridden slum district of Lisbon and taking over from Cristiano Ronaldo as captain in the Euro 2016 final
results.secPara: Nani could not understand it. His mind was scrambled and the situation would affect him physically. The Portugal winger had been given a new five-year contract at Manchester United in September 2013 by the manager, David Moyes, and, having joined from Sporting Lisbon in 2007, he felt wanted and ready to fire himself to higher levels. Then Moyes did not play him. Or at least he hardly did so. In 2013-14 Nani would start only seven Premier League games.
results.webTitle: Nani: ‘United contract could have been best moment of my life – but it turned into the worst’
